alert.note: Alert for Camden; Laclede; Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 6:44AM CDT until August 01 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Camden County in central Missouri... Pulaski County in central Missouri... Northern Laclede County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 1245 PM CDT Tuesday. * At 644 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Leonard Wood, Lebanon, Waynesville, St. Robert, Richland, Crocker, Stoutland, Ozark Springs, Laquey, Swedeborg, Sleeper and Eldridge. This includes the following low water crossings... Elliot Branch at Highway NN, Bear Creek at Highway FF, Tavern Creek at Highway U, Williamson Branch at Riley Drive, Shakerag Creek at Highway H, Dry Auglaize Creek at Highway BB and Williams Branch at Riley Drive. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
